etymologies: late Middle English: from French cosmographie, or via late Latin from Greek kosmographia, from kosmos (see cosmos) + -graphia ‘writing’

definitions: the science that deals with the general features of the universe, including the earth. The branches of cosmography include astronomy, geography, and geology

examples.text: he published a series of elementary textbooks on cosmography, trigonometry, and astronomy (1651)

shortDefinitions: branch of science which deals with general features of universe

definitions: a description or representation of the universe or the earth
shortDefinitions: description or representation of universe or earth
